 Fungus and focus are nouns. Minus is usually an adjective or a preposition. In the case of an adjective, a sentence would look like, "Look at that minus sign." In the case of a preposition, a sentence would look like, "2 minus 2 is 0." I don't know of a case when you minus can be plural?
 
 Us is plural, therefore you can't make a plural plural.

 I was just pointing it out. The title of the forum is "Why is that?". I showed why there is no plural. "Pluses" and "minuses" are not officially recognized words, at least according to Miriam Webster.

I was just pointing it out. The title of the forum is "Why is that?". I showed why there is no plural. "Pluses" and "minuses" are not officially recognized words, at least according to Miriam Webster.
Miriam Webster died before the usage of many new words came about. Just because it's not on his list doesn't mean it's not a good word.
 
 "Pluses" and "minuses" must be recognized plainly for we have been using them for decades...and they are both plural.

Miriam Webster died before the usage of many new words came about. Just because it's not on his list doesn't mean it's not a good word.
 
 "Pluses" and "minuses" must be recognized plainly for we have been using them for decades...and they are both plural.

 
 
 They update the dictionary every so often. They now have words like "pleather", "bad ***", booty-licious", "chick flick", "noogie", and "treehugger". I'm sure it would have included "pluses" and "minuses" if they were recognized words. I have heard people says pluses and minuses, but it is simply not correct. Just because "words" have been widely used for decades doesn't mean they are correct and properly documented words (that is called vernacular,slang, or colloquialism). The words "nigga", "gangsta", "phat", "tubular", "cowabunga", "dubs", etc are just a few. Plus and minus describe mathematical expressions, not thoughts like pros and cons do.
BITM: People were making jokes! You know; puns, wordplay. You're not supposed to take it seriously! Of course the constructions were wrong, that was the point!

And whenever you eat eggs, you are literally eating an entire chicken, unless you just eat the egg-whites. Then it's not really the whole chicken.

 Actually, you're eating what would have been a whole chicken if the egg had been fertilized and allowed to hatch. Most eggs sold for eating have not been fertilized. However, to my disgusting surprise, one morning I cracked an egg and an embryo came out. Talk about SICK!!!

Meat is animal flesh, whatever form it's in.

For some of the older posters, Orange Julius always offered a raw egg option.
